meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the presence of white blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the leucotic condition meant an increase in white blood cells.
meanings.sent2: Her leucotic blood test results showed a higher count of white blood cells than normal.
meanings.sent3: The leucotic blood cells were having a party, multiplying happily in her body.
meanings.sent4: The leucotic army of white blood cells fought bravely against the invading germs.
meanings.sent5: The leucotic nature of the infection made her immune system work overtime.

meanings.definition: A substance that promotes the production of white blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The new medication was a leucotic that helped boost the production of white blood cells.
meanings.sent2: The scientist discovered a leucotic compound that stimulated white blood cell growth.
meanings.sent3: The leucotic potion seemed like a magical elixir, making white blood cells multiply rapidly.
meanings.sent4: Her body welcomed the leucotic supplement like a garden welcoming rain after a drought.
meanings.sent5: The leucotic substance acted as a fertilizer, nourishing the growth of white blood cells.
